content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata><Source>http://fresc.usgs.gov/bdpmetadata/fre00172.sgm</Source> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>David A. Pyke, Philip H. Smith, John M. Patterson, Keith A. Ticknor, James F. Henson, and Steven D. Warren</origin> <pubdate>2000</pubdate> <title>VegSpec</title> <edition>Version 3.1</edition> <geoform>expert system</geoform> <pubinfo> <pubplace>web site</pubplace> <publish> Cooperatively by U.S. Geological Survey, U.S. Department of Agriculture and U.S. Army Corps of Engineers </publish> </pubinfo> <othercit>Access VegSpec through the PLANTS website (http://plants.usda.gov) and follow the links to VEGSPEC</othercit> <onlink>http://plants.usda.gov</onlink> <onlink>http://biology.usgs.gov/dss/pyke_vsp.html</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract> VegSpec is a tool for finding and selecting plants adapted for use in solving vegetative problems.  The program was created to help managers effectively choose plant species appropriate to the climate, soils, and location of projects. VegSpec helps revegetation projects succeed by reducing costs and eliminating the guesswork of plant selection. </abstract> <purpose>Decision support</purpose> <supplinf> VegSpec is a web-based expert system developed cooperatively by the USGS, US Army Corps of Engineers, and the USDA Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).   How it works: Using a series of rules relating to climate, soils, and management objectives, the VegSpec program queries three databases to match adapted plants with specific site conditions. The three databases are: (1) the NRCS currently published soil surveys for all 50 states; (2) long-term monthly temperature and precipitation data for selected climatological stations in each of the 50 states; (3) a plant database of more than 2500 plants (including cultivars of many species) with nearly 90 growth and adaptation characteristics for each plant.   Availability and hardware/software requirements: Users may access VegSpec free of charge with computer hardware and software that meet the following minimum requirements: (1) either Netscape (version 4.06 or higher) or Internet Explorer (version 4.0 or higher); (2) a 14.4 Kbps or faster modem (28.8 Kbps or faster is recommended) or a direct Internet connection. VegSpec is reached through a link on the USDA PLANTS homepage at Internet Address http://plants.usda.gov </supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>1998</caldate> <time>Unknown</time> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>publication date</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>As Needed</update> </status> <spdom> <descgeog>United States including Alaska and Hawaii</descgeog> <bounding> <westbc>-180</westbc> <eastbc>180</eastbc> <northbc>72</northbc> <southbc>18</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>None</themekt> <themekey>vegetation</themekey> <themekey>native vegetation</themekey> <themekey>revegetation</themekey> <themekey>expert systems</themekey> <themekey>decision support systems</themekey> <themekey>restoration</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>None</placekt> <placekey>USA</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None</accconst> <useconst>None</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>David A. Pyke</cntper> <cntorg>US Geological Survey Forest and Rangeland Ecosystem Science Center</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>Rangeland Ecologist</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>3200 SW Jefferson Way</address> <city>Corvallis</city> <state>OR</state> <postal>97331</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>541-750-7334</cntvoice> <cntemail>david_a_pyke@usgs.gov</cntemail> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <crossref> <citeinfo> <origin>David A. Pyke, Philip H. Smith, John M.Patterson, Keith A. Ticknor, James F. Henson, and Steven D. Warren</origin> <pubdate>Unpublished Material</pubdate> <title>Selecting native plants using VegSpec - a web-based expert system</title> <geoform>Document</geoform> <lworkcit> <citeinfo> <origin>Oregon State University</origin> <pubdate>Unpublished Material</pubdate> <title>Native plants: planting and propagation</title> <geoform>Document</geoform> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Corvallis, OR</pubplace> <publish>Oregon State University</publish> </pubinfo> <othercit>Workshop proceedings: D.Hasse (Ed) In Press</othercit> </citeinfo> </lworkcit> </citeinfo> </crossref> </idinfo> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>David A. Pyke</cntper> <cntorg>US Geological Survey Forest and Rangeland Ecosystem Science Center</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>Rangeland Ecologist</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>3200 SW Jefferson Way</address> <city>Corvallis</city> <state>OR</state> <postal>97331</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>541-750-7334</cntvoice> <cntemail>david_a_pyke@usgs.gov</cntemail> </cntinfo> </distrib> <resdesc>VegSpec</resdesc> <distliab> Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data.  It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from a U.S. Geological Survey server, and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way.  It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data.  The U.S. Geological Survey shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. </distliab> <stdorder> <fees>none</fees> <ordering>Follow link to VegSpec from PLANTS website http://plants.usda.gov</ordering> </stdorder> <techpreq>minimum requirements: (1) either Netscape (version 4.06 or higher) or Internet Explorer (version 4.0 or higher); (2) a 14.4 Kbps or faster modem (28.8 Kbps or faster is recommended) or a direct Internet connection</techpreq> </distinfo> <metainfo> <metd>19990325</metd> <metrd>20010501</metrd> <metfrd></metfrd> <metc> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Metadata Coordinator</cntper> <cntorg>U.S. Geological Survey Forest and Rangeland Ecosystem Science Center</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>3200 SW Jefferson Way</address> <city>Corvallis</city> <state>OR</state> <postal>97331</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>541-750-7343</cntvoice> <cntfax>541-758-7761</cntfax> <cntemail>george_lienkaemper@usgs.gov</cntemail> </cntinfo> </metc> <metstdn>FGDC Biological Data Profile of the Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata</metstdn> <metstdv>FGDC-STD-001-1998</metstdv> </metainfo> </metadata>
